capital of a political entity

sector.narrative: Accelerate structural transformations

description.narrative:
L’effet 2 : Variation du nombre des tunisiens.nes qui saisissent les Instances (cible=10% de progression) Produit 2.1 : Ind 2.1.1. Nombre de passages télé et radio des spots vidéo et audio inclusifs (cible=80) Ind 2.1.2. Nombre de visualisations sur les réseaux sociaux et site web des spots vidéo (cible=1,000,000) Produit 2.2 : Ind 2.2.1. % de la population considérant la torture une atteinte aux droits humains (cible=20%) Ind 2.2.2. % de la population qui considère les traitements cruels, inhumains ou dégradants comme étant des atteintes aux droits humains (cible=20%)
L’effet 3 : Nombre de nouvelles publications/instance/an (cible=10) Produit 3.1 : Ind 3.1.1 - Nombre de publications, prenant en compte l’inclusion, avant la fin du projet (cible=10)

comment.narrative:
L’effet 2 : Les populations, en particulier les populations directement concernées par les interventions des Instances, sollicitent leurs interventions et accèdent à leurs services respectifs Cet effet comporte les produits suivants : Produit 2.1 : Les populations, en particulier celles directement concernées par les interventions des Instances, y compris les femmes, les jeunes et les groupes vulnérables, sont mieux informées et sensibilisées sur les rôles respectifs des Instances, leurs prérogatives et modalités de saisine et d’intervention. Produit 2.2: Les populations, en particulier celles directement concernées par les interventions des Instances, y compris les femmes, les jeunes et les groupes vulnérables, sont mieux informées et sensibilisées sur leurs droits et les risques liés à la torture et à la traite des personnes
L’effet 3 : L’instance nationale pour la prévention de la torture (INPT) et de l’Instance nationale de lutte contre la traite des personnes (INLTP) produisent et partagent des connaissances en matière de prévention de la torture et de la lutte contre la traite des personnes Cet effet comporte les produits suivants : Produit 3.1?: Des recherches en lien avec la prévention de la torture et la lutte contre la traite des personnes sont réalisées et diffusées
nb de videos produites (sensibilisation, communication) = 4 nb d'événement organisés = 4

l’INPT a présenté son mandat au grand public et de présenter l’approche qu’elle a suivi dans sa réponse à la pandémie en assurant les visites préventives aux lieux de privation de liberté et aux centres de confinement pour s’assurer du respect des droits humains et de l’inexistence de pratiques ou traitements inhumains, cruels ou dégradants lors de l’application des mesures restrictives à cause de la COVID-19. 4 événements de sensibilisation organisés Annonce du prix Mandela qui sera décerné annuellement par l’INPT en collaboration avec l’Ambassade de l’Afrique du Sud en Tunisie Production et diffusion de vidéos inclusives sur e rôle des instances

description.narrative: a. Number of comprehensive assessments report to identify MSMEs impacted by the pandemic and data base set up. b. 5000 youths (60% women) with enhanced awareness on vocational training and assisted with start-up grants for small businesses related to COVID-19 response including Hygiene and sanitation materials c. Number of online mobile platforms set up for MSMEs for enhanced virtual service provisions/ improvements. d. Number of integrated MSMEs with supply chains with industrial parks for better income. e. Number of “one window” service established by the Government in the regions on SMEs supported.

comment.narrative: a. There is very little data on the impact of the pandemic on MSMEs in order to set up a data base and enable small business to regain their productivity b. Small enterprises mostly of women owned are unable to become self-supportive and incapable due to COVID-19 pandemic c. Lack of functioning online mobile platform for MSMEs for an enhanced virtual service provisions/ improvement. d. Lack of integration of MSMEs with supply chains for industrial parks e. Lack of functional capacity of a “one window” service established by the Government in the regions on SMEs.

α. At least 1 socio-economic impact report on the pandemic is accessible and used to set up a data base on MSMEs. b. 5000 youths (60% women) are supported through vocational training and with business startup capital c. one functional online mobile platform for MSMEs is established /installed for enhanced virtual service provisions/ improvements. d. three or more MSMEs are integrated with supply chains through industrial parks. e. At least one “one window” services established by the Government in the regions on SMEs are reinforced through capacity building process.

description.narrative: 1. Reinforcing the national COVID-19 response through procurement of PPE including N95 Masks, surgical masks, half-faced masks, hand & surface sanitizer, latex gloves, needle and syringes, face shield, medical gown, infrared- thermometer, pulse oximeter, disposable shoe cover, sprayer, and condom. 2. Improvements in health and community systems and supports the country to respond impact of COVID-19 among the most vulnerable population through the procurement of medical devices including Viral load Machine, CD4 Machines, GeneXpert Machines, and cartridges.

comment.narrative:
2020 Targets:
1. PPE - N95 Masks: 12,000 (Pcs) - Surgical masks: 332,615 (Pcs) - Half-faced masks: 120 (Pcs) - Alcohol-based hand sanitizer: 11,800 (Bottle of 500 cc) - Surface sanitizer: 6,590 (Bottle of 4 liter) - Latex gloves: 13,800 (Pcs) - Needle and syringes: 1,151,820 (Pcs) - Face shield: 4,900 (Pcs) - Medical gown: 5,840 (Pcs) - Infrared- thermometer: 1,192 (Pcs) - Pulse oximeter: 240 (Pcs) - Disposable shoe cover: 108,000 (Pcs) - Sprayer: 700 (Pcs) - Electric sprayer: 20 (Pcs) - Condom: 20,000 (Packs of 144)
2. Medical devices: - Viral load Machine: 5 - CD4 Machines: 12 - GeneXpert Machines: 4 - GeneXpert cartridges: 14,500

description.narrative: # of women provided with health care insurance and work accident insurance.

comment.narrative: # of women provided with health care insurance and work accident insurance. BL: 0

- Provide 48 women with health care insurance and work accident insurance. - Conduct a rapid survey and impact assessment of COVID-19 on the communities in the designated municipalities. - Enhance the engagement of 80 women in responding to C19 through designing and implementing women-led community health initiatives. - Hire a consultant to develop an action plan for the WEE units to support in the immediate activities that will be implemented under the project.

- 48 women were provided with health care insurance and work accident insurance. - A rapid survey and impact assessment of COVID-19 on the communities in the designated municipalities was conducted. - 80 Women were enaged in responding to C19 through designing and implementing women-led community health initiatives were enhanced. - A consultant was hired to develop an action plan for the WEE units to support in the immediate activities that will be implemented under the project
- Develop a capacity building plans and Annual Action Plans for 4 WEE units.

description.narrative: Resilience of agricultural sector increased in the Dry Zone of Myanmar to climate change and COVID-19 impacts by promoting and scaling up innovative and resilient agricultural practices, value chains and access to technologies
capital of a political entity

sector.narrative: Accelerate structural transformations

description.narrative:
1) Institutional strengthening of Department of Agriculture (DOA) and Livestock Breeding and Veterinary Department (LBVD) in two townships
2) Training programmes for Interactive workshops between farmers and agricultural/livestock businesses and input suppliers.
3) Interactive workshops between farmers and agricultural/livestock businesses and input suppliers.
4) Improved access of rural communities, especially farmers and casual labourers to markets, financial services catalysed by mobile wallets, inputs, storage and rental of machinery and transport.

comment.narrative:
1) Agricultural extension services are weak and poorly connected with research, relevant industries and the private sector.
2) Agricultural extension services are weak and poorly connected with research, relevant industries and the private sector.

1) The project envisions the strengthening of institutional capacities in agricultural extension by enhancing facilities and strengthening human resources in relevant government agencies.
2) 260 Farmers will be trained in the use of mobile phones to collect data via geo-tagged photographs of pests and crop conditions for analysis and feedback by experts in the Dept. of Agriculture and Department of Agricultural Research.
3) Indicator 1.1.3.4: Whether the country undertook socio-economic impact assessments in response to the COVID-19 crisis, with a focus on vulnerable groups, directed at-risk populations. c) Multi-sectoral and sectoral needs assessment = yes; e) Human impact needs assessment for at risk populations = yes

To be updated: 1) The project envisions the strengthening of institutional capacities in agricultural extension by enhancing facilities and strengthening human resources in relevant government agencies.
2) 260 Farmers will be trained in the use of mobile phones to collect data via geo-tagged photographs of pests and crop conditions for analysis and feedback by experts in the Dept. of Agriculture and Department of Agricultural Research.
3) Indicator 1.1.3.4: Whether the country undertook socio-economic impact assessments in response to the COVID-19 crisis, with a focus on vulnerable groups, directed at-risk populations. c) Multi-sectoral and sectoral needs assessment = yes; e) Human impact needs assessment for at risk populations = yes

Les initiatives de promotion des talents et de la créativité sont appuyées, en partenariat avec le secteur privé et les collectivités locales, à travers la mise en place d’un fond de micro-subventions (réorientées afin de réponse à la crise pandémique de la COVID-19 et aux effets pervers causés par les mesures de confinement ) 3.1.1 Nombre d'initiatives de la société civile soutenues pour la mise en œuvre de la vision sectorielle de la jeunesse Baseline : 42 3.1.2. % de femmes parmi les chef.fe.s de projet des organisations de la société civile dont les initiatives ont été soutenues pour la mise en oeuvre de la vision sectorielle de la jeunesse Baseline : 48%

description.narrative: Socio-Economic Recovery from negative consequences of COVID-19 in Osh, Jalal-Abad and Batken provinces of the Kyrgyz Republic
Activités spécifiques Covid-19 de l'Outcome 3 du portefeuille ODD16+ permettant de faire bénéficier communautés (jeunes, femmes et groupes vulnérables,) des efforts de développement
capital of a political entity

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative: N/A

comment.narrative: - Soutien au Parlement tunisien pour lui permettre de continuer à exercer son rôle et son mandat pendant la phase de confinement (Produit 1.1. du portefeuille) : 217 députés et 83 membres du personnel de l'administration parlementaire disposent de moyens renforcés pour exercer leur rôle législatif et de contrôle pendant la phase de confinement - Soutien aux autorités locales afin de leur permettre de continuer à fournir les services publics locaux essentiels (gestion des déchets, nettoyage des espaces publics, services funéraires) (Output 1.3. du portefeuille) : 506 employé.e.s municipaux reçoivent un équipement de protection et du matériel d'hygiène leur permettant d'améliorer leurs conditions de travail pendant la phase de confinement et de réduire la probabilité de contamination et de diffusion du virus dans leurs communautés - Soutien à une série d’institutions clés (Conseil supérieur de la magistrature, Instance nationale de prévention de la torture et Instance nationale de lutte contre la traite des personnes) dans le développement de plans de continuité en cas de crises (Output 1.4.). - Soutien au ministère de l'intérieur pour la fourniture d'équipements de soins intensifs à l'hôpital de La Marsa afin de permettre le traitement des patients des forces de sécurité intérieure et de leurs dépendants (Output 1.5. du document de portefeuille) : L'hôpital ISF de La Marsa, qui dessert près de 10 000 agents déployés dans le Grand Tunis, est équipé de 6 unités de soins intensifs - Soutien à la Commission nationale de lutte contre le terrorisme dans la compréhension de l’évolution du discours de la haine dans les réseaux sociaux pendant le confinement (Produit 1.6) : Une recherche est lancée pour identifier comment les discours de haine en ligne étant liés au COVID-19 sont utilisés pour alimenter les divisions et finalement promouvoir l'extrémisme violent. Cette étude a pour objectif de permettre d’informer l’élaboration de stratégies préventives sur le discours alternatif. - Soutien au Comité national des prisons et de la rééducation pour la fabrication de matériel de protection pour les détenus, le personnel pénitentiaire et le personnel du ministère de la santé dans les ateliers qui existent dans quatre prisons (Output 2.2. du portefeuille) : 200 000 masques et 8650 combinaisons de protection ont été fabriqués au niveau de trois prisons dont celle des femmes de la Manouba. Ces équipements de protection sont au profit de 23 000 détenu.e.s, 7000 membres du personnel pénitencier, du Ministère de la Santé et des FSI. - Soutien à la société civile et aux communautés pour contribuer efficacement à la réponse Covid-19 (Outputs 1.8, 2.4., 2.6 et 2.7) : - Appui au ministère en charge des Droits de l’Homme et des Relations avec la Société Civile pour la mobilisation, l’équipement et le renforcement des capacités des bénévoles engagés dans la mise en œuvre de la campagne nationale de solidarité et d’aide aux populations vulnérables. - Les 16 comités locaux de sécurité (CLS) ont entrepris plus de 110 actions avec la société civile et les autorités locales. Ces actions ont facilité la collecte de dons, la désinfection des établissements publics et des hôpitaux, la fabrication et la distribution de masques et de combinaisons de protection, la distribution d'aides financières de l'État et de produits alimentaires de base aux plus vulnérables - La réorientation de 26 initiatives de la société civile autour de trois grands axes : i) la sensibilisation de la population aux mesures sanitaires ; ii) la prévention de la propagation du virus ; et iii) le soutien aux populations isolées et vulnérables, notamment les femmes et les personnes âgées. 400 jeunes volontaires ont été mobilisé.e.s et près de 30 000 personnes ont bénéficié des actions entreprises. - Soutien logistique aux services de la ministre chargée de la fonction publique pour piloter les dispositions relatives au télétravail en lien avec les priorités gouvernementales (Output 3.3.)

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative: Response to COVID-19 pandemic in Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina
The main objective of the JAP is to help design, implement, monitor and evaluate evidence-based and gender-sensitive measures to maintain the productive base and firm structure (formal/informal).
capital of a political entity

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative: a. Number of comprehensive assessments report to identify MSMEs impacted by the pandemic and data base set up. b. 5000 youths (60% women) with enhanced awareness on vocational training and assisted with start-up grants for small businesses related to COVID-19 response including Hygiene and sanitation materials c. Number of online mobile platforms set up for MSMEs for enhanced virtual service provisions/ improvements. d. Number of integrated MSMEs with supply chains with industrial parks for better income. e. Number of “one window” service established by the Government in the regions on SMEs supported. f. Number of updated and need-based assessment reports on potential green jobs. g. Number of small enterprises directly impacted by the pandemic benefited from emergency COVID-19 support to revamp businesses and jobs for the youth (60% women). h. Number of youths (20,000; 60% women) engaged in cash for work through waste management and hygiene improvement interventions. i. Number of youths (60% women) in rural areas engaged on planting of agro-forestry trees in degraded areas through cash for work to enhance environmental conservation.

comment.narrative: a. There is very little data on the impact of the pandemic on MSMEs in order to set up a data base and enable small business to regain their productivity b. Small enterprises mostly of women owned are unable to become self-supportive and incapable due to COVID-19 pandemic c. Lack of functioning online mobile platform for MSMEs for an enhanced virtual service provisions/ improvement. d. Lack of integration of MSMEs with supply chains for industrial parks e. Lack of functional capacity of a “one window” service established by the Government in the regions on SMEs. f. Lack of updated and need-based assessment conducted, and potential green jobs documented. g. Lack of resources to provide support to pandemic impacted small enterprises to retain jobs. h. Insufficient resources to ensure proper waste management, good hygiene and jobs that benefit 20,000 youth (60% women) i. Lack of income for rural communities impacted by the pandemic

α. At least 1 socio-economic impact report on the pandemic is accessible and used to set up a data base on MSMEs. b. 5000 youths (60% women) are supported through vocational training and with business startup capital c. one functional online mobile platform for MSMEs is established /installed for enhanced virtual service provisions/ improvements. d. three or more MSMEs are integrated with supply chains through industrial parks. e. At least one “one window” services established by the Government in the regions on SMEs are reinforced through capacity building process. f. At least one updated and need-based assessment report on potential green jobs accessible. g. 500 small enterprises directly impacted by the pandemic are supported and led to 50,000 jobs retained. h. 20,000 youths (60% women) have received cash through cash for work on waste management and hygiene improvements i. 5000 youths (60% women) have engaged on planting of agro–forestry trees in degraded areas through cash for work

description.narrative: Brindar asistencia requerida por el Gobierno de Honduras, a través de la Secretaria de Trabajao y Seguridad Social para la reactivación económica en respuesta a la emergencia del COVID19 y fenómenos naturales que han afectado a Honduras.

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative: The objective of the initiation plan is to formulate innovative projects to support Viet Nam in preparing and implementing plans for the fast, sustainable and inclusive recovery, in the context of uncertainty induced by COVID-19.
capital of a political entity

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative: Number and quality (with opportunities for scaling up innovative solutions, partnership and resource mobilization) of project concept notes developed in close cooperation with relevant partners

comment.narrative: Non-existence of new (long-term/full scale) project concept notes/ documents on i) Anticipatory Governance for Inclusive IR4.0/inclusive IR4.0; ii) expanding private sector investment/SDG financing; iii) enhancing productivity and competitiveness and development of Viet Nam’s private sector/SMEs; iii) Fiscal decentralization in health and education sectors; Sharing economy
4 project documents and Concept notes have been developed.

description.narrative: To setup a Network of Local Governments in response to the Coronavirus crisis in Jordan. This Network will promote an open government and increase linkages between different government entities through digital tools to boost preparedness
capital of a political entity

sector.narrative: Accelerate structural transformations

description.narrative: Development of WhatsApp group that connects central and local governance Completion of needs assessment by Mayors and Governors Level of benefit of participants from capacity building exercises Number of professionals participating in the communities of practice Satisfaction levels of participants with the communities of practice Number of multipurpose IT rooms in allocated a maximum 50 governorate/municipalities

comment.narrative: Rapid Response Facility and HEWAR community Dialogue projects

description.narrative: Comprende el apoyo a la respuesta ante la COVID-19, a partir de recursos adicionales TRAC por USD 140mil, para compra de insumos para hospitales, diagnóstico de efectos de las medidas de contención y fortalecimiento de capacidades de gerencia pública.
